definition: indisputable statement/unalterable truth
(negative prefix)/not/no
to print/to publish/publication/periodical/to peel with a knife/to carve/to amend
old variant of 刊[kan1]/to peel with a knife/to carve/to amend
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
abbr. for 論語|论语[Lun2 yu3], The Analects (of Confucius)
opinion/view/theory/doctrine/to discuss/to talk about/to regard/to consider/per/by the (kilometer, hour etc)

sentences.english: That conclusion has been accepted by many as an article of faith ever since.
sentences.chinese: 从那时起，这一结论就被许多人当成了不刊之论。

sentences.english: The conclusion, and arguments of this book is unalterable truth.
sentences.chinese: 这本著作的结论和观点已是不刊之论。

definition: perfectly sound proposition/unalterable truth/irrefutable argument
not to be taken as an example/not an example to be followed/not to be taken as authoritative
to pass on errors or lies (idiom); the propagation of misconceptions

lit. Ying writes a letter and Yan reads it/fig. to misinterpret the original meaning/to pile up errors/refers to the letter from capital 郢[Ying3] of 楚[Chu3] in which the inadvertent words "hold up the candle" are mistaken by the minister of 燕[Yan1] as "promote the wise"
modern people
to blot out at one stroke/to reject out of hand/to deny without a hearing
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
forged book/book of dubious authenticity/misattributed book/Apocrypha
to keep silent/to make no comment
to be ridiculous/to make a fool of oneself
absurd statement/cock-and-bull story
one who can correct a misread or misspelt character and thus be your master
error in a text/text corruption
to write a flawless essay in one go (idiom)/to be quick-witted and skilled at writing compositions
to reject a word because of the speaker (idiom, from Analects); to judge on preference between advisers rather than the merits of the case
a wrong repeated becomes right (idiom); a lie or an error passed on for a long time may be taken for the truth
